metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6253 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the DirectX and OpenGL Usermode drivers where a specially crafted pixel shader can cause infinite recursion leading to denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-384 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-cfg1-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-common-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-compute-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-decode-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-encode-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-fbc1-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-gl-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
libnvidia-ifr1-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-384 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-compute-utils-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-dkms-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-driver-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-headless-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-headless-no-dkms-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-kernel-common-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-kernel-source-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-libopencl1-384 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-opencl-icd-384 - 390.48-0ubuntu3
nvidia-utils-390 - 390.48-0ubuntu3

No subscription required
